body: If this feature support is there, Please point out the correct command . Else, Please let me know the starting entry point of which file such that I can tweak the code to support SSL
I mean after entering cli.py, where are these being used ? or where is this being referenced ?
@nov301996 Are you looking for how to specify options for SSL like https://stackoverflow.com/a/48851490?

@harupy , but Can I know the entry point when I run the command - 

When I run the command - 

mlflow server --backend-store-uri postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/test --default-artifact-root /Users/a222340/mlflow/examples/quickstart

On a high level, Can i know the flow of which file is called first and it goes to which file ?
@nov301996 What do you mean by "the entry point"?

@nov301996 We run mlflow on AKS and we use Azure Database for MySql. We have configured MySQL to accept onlt SSL connections. Our docker image has an custom entrypoint which is a script and we bake the certificate within the image. We do the following. I am not sure if this is what you are expecting?

`mlflow server --backend-store-uri=mysql+pymysql://${MLFLOW_USER}:${MLFLOW_PASS}@${MLFLOW_DB_ADDR}:${MLFLOW_DB_PORT}/${MLFLOW_DB_NAME}?ssl_ca=./BaltimoreCyberTrustRoot.crt.pem --default-artifact-root=${MLFLOW_ARTIFACT_PATH} --serve-artifacts --gunicorn-opts "--log-level warning" --host 0.0.0.0 --port 80`

@haripraghash Thanks for the comment!

@nov301996 Can you try the suggested command?

<!-- reminder-to-issue-author -->
@nov301996 Any updates here? If you're working on a PR, please link it to this issue.

Hello Harutaka,

Yes, I missed these mentions, messages and mails. But yeah that command
works. So, we don't need any new commit's/MRs

Thanks & Regards
Vaibhav Kartik
